ground_truth: She glances around and frowns to herself, her lips parted. She answers her cell as the front door opens and David enters. She waves at David and nods at the phone; David hands her a cup of coffee and then fixes his own coffee in the kitchen of the one-room flat. She hangs up, noticing her phone shows four missed calls from Adrian. David looks up knowingly, his thoughtful gaze drifting as she glances aside and her lips spread into a sad smile. David blinks and moves to a chair at her bedside, as she meets his gaze. Swallowing hard, Elise averts her eyes. As she looks at him again, she smiles wistfully while David gives her a contented look. Her eyes glimmer with tears as she meets his gaze and David crooks a smile. Elise's smile fades as she stares into David's earnest eyes, and they gaze tenderly at each other before blinking and David looks away. He juts out his jaw, then locks eyes with her. Now Elise sits in a green room as, in the studio, David shakes Jon Stewart's hand and waves to the audience. Meanwhile, a guy in a ball cap enters the green room, Elise's shoulders sag as the man leaves, and she collects her belongings. Now as David leaves the studio, the man in the ball cap opens the door for him. David texts as he walks through the doorway, and lifting his gaze from his phone, he finds himself in the Adjustment Bureau warehouse. He whips around to the closed door but finds it locked, tries another one, then attempts to lift a loading bay door. Now David sits with his back against a support beam, and as he stares off, a figure appears—the steely-eyed adjustment officer approaches. Rising, David stares at him and looks Thompson in the eyes as Thompson paces away from him. David follows, observing Thompson standing still, his thoughtful eyes blinking, shifting his gaze to a bay door which begins to rise. With a determined look, David hurries past Thompson to the exit as the adjustment officer blinks his disapproving eyes. Meanwhile, at Cedar Lake, dancers perform on one section of a low, L-shaped stage, twirling gracefully while male dancers leap across the other section, drop to their knees, and spin. David rides in the back of a cab, his eyes shifting to his window as the city's glimmering lights glide past. The taxi slows in front of Cedar Lake, and now David enters the dance studio, joining a group of patrons standing near a tiered section of stage. Elise sits on the top platform, her feet resting on a bench below it; as she hunches forward, a group of dancers gathered behind her lifts her into the air.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: She looks around and scowls to herself, her lips open. She replies to her mobile as the front entrance opens and David arrives. She signals at David and nods at the phone; David gives her a cup of espresso and then prepares his own espresso in the kitchen of the one-room apartment. She hangs up, observing her mobile shows four missed calls from Adrian. David glances up knowingly, his pensive gaze wandering as she looks aside and her lips widen into a melancholy smile. David blinks and moves to a seat at her bedside, as she meets his gaze. Swallowing hard, Elise turns her eyes. As she looks at him again, she smiles longingly while David gives her a satisfied look. Her eyes shine with tears as she meets his gaze and David curls a smile. Elise's smile diminishes as she stares into David's sincere eyes, and they gaze affectionately at each other before blinking and David looks away. He projects out his jaw, then locks eyes with her. Now Elise sits in a green chamber as, in the studio, David shakes Jon Stewart's hand and waves to the audience. Meanwhile, a man in a ball cap enters the green chamber, Elise's shoulders droop as the man leaves, and she gathers her possessions. Now as David leaves the studio, the man in the ball cap opens the door for him. David texts as he walks through the doorway, and lifting his gaze from his mobile, he finds himself in the Adjustment Bureau storeroom. He spins around to the closed door but finds it locked, tries another one, then attempts to lift a loading bay door. Now David sits with his back against a support beam, and as he stares off, a figure appears—the steely-eyed adjustment officer approaches. Rising, David stares at him and looks Thompson in the eyes as Thompson strides away from him. David follows, observing Thompson standing still, his pensive eyes blinking, shifting his gaze to a bay door which begins to rise. With a resolute look, David rushes past Thompson to the exit as the adjustment officer blinks his reproachful eyes. Meanwhile, at Cedar Lake, dancers perform on one section of a low, L-shaped platform, twirling gracefully while male dancers leap across the other section, drop to their knees, and spin. David rides in the back of a cab, his eyes shifting to his window as the city's shimmering lights glide past. The taxi slows in front of Cedar Lake, and now David enters the dance studio, joining a group of patrons standing near a tiered section of platform. Elise sits on the top platform, her feet resting on a bench below it; as she crouches forward, a group of dancers gathered behind her lifts her into the air.

David is waved at by her and the phone is nodded at; a cup of coffee is handed to her by David and then his own coffee is fixed by him in the kitchen of the one-room flat. David looks up knowingly, his thoughtful gaze drifts as her glance is averted and a sad smile is spread by her lips. As she looks at him again, a wistful smile is given by her while a contented look is given by David to her. Her eyes glimmer with tears as his gaze is met by her and a smile is crooked by David. Elise’s smile fades as David's earnest eyes are stared into by her, and tender gazes are exchanged by them before blinks are shared and David looks away. Meanwhile, a guy in a ball cap enters the green room, Elise's shoulders sag as the man leaves, and her belongings are collected by her. Now as the studio is left by David, the door is opened for him by the man in the ball cap. A text is sent by David as he walks through the doorway, and as his gaze is lifted from his phone, the Adjustment Bureau warehouse is found by him. He whips around to the closed door but finds it locked, tries another one, then a loading bay door is attempted to be lifted by him. Now his back is sat against a support beam by David, and as he stares off, a figure appears—the steely-eyed adjustment officer approaches. Rising, him is stared at by David and Thompson is looked in the eyes by David as pacing away is done by Thompson away from him. Thompson is followed by David, observing him standing still, his thoughtful eyes blinking, his gaze shifting to a bay door which has begun to rise. With a determined look, Thompson is hurried past by David to the exit as the adjustment officer blinks his disapproving eyes. Meanwhile, at Cedar Lake, a performance is given by dancers on one section of a low, L-shaped stage, twirling gracefully while male dancers leap across the other section, drop to their knees, and spin. The back of a cab is ridden in by David, his eyes shifting to his window as the city's glimmering lights glide past. Elise sits on the top platform, her feet resting on a bench below it; as she hunches forward, she is lifted into the air by a group of dancers gathered behind her.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: She glances around, frowns, and answers her cell as David enters. She waves at him and nods at the phone; he hands her a coffee and fixes his own in their one-room flat. Hanging up, she notices four missed calls from Adrian. David looks knowingly as she smiles sadly. He moves to a chair by her side, meeting her gaze. Elise swallows, averts her eyes, then smiles wistfully at David's contented look. Her eyes glimmer with tears as they share a tender gaze before looking away. Elise, now in a green room, watches David shaking Jon Stewart's hand in the studio. A man in a ball cap enters, and Elise's shoulders sag as he leaves. She collects her belongings, and as David exits the studio, the man opens the door for him. David texts while walking and finds himself in the Adjustment Bureau warehouse. He turns to a locked door, attempts another, then tries to lift a loading bay door. David sits against a support beam until a steely-eyed adjustment officer appears. Rising, David meets Thompson's eyes as he paces away. David follows Thompson, whose eyes shift to a rising bay door. Determined, David hurries past Thompson to the exit as the officer blinks disapprovingly. At Cedar Lake, dancers twirl and leap across the stage. David rides in a cab, eyes on the city's glimmering lights. The taxi stops at Cedar Lake, and David enters the dance studio, joining patrons by a tiered stage. Elise sits on the top platform, and dancers lift her into the air as she hunches forward.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Elise glances around, frowning and answering her phone as David enters, handing her coffee before making his own. She notices four missed calls from Adrian and shares a sad smile with David. They exchange wistful looks as tears fill her eyes. In the green room, Elise watches David shake Jon Stewart's hand at the studio. A man in a ball cap enters and leaves, and Elise collects her things. As David exits, the man holds the door open, and David finds himself in the Adjustment Bureau warehouse. Locked doors surround him until a figure appears—an adjustment officer. David follows him to a rising bay door, then hurries past as the officer disapproves. At Cedar Lake, dancers twirl and leap. David watches from a taxi before entering the studio, joining patrons near the stage. Elise sits atop a platform as dancers lift her into the air.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
She glances around the room, her gaze sweeping across the familiar surroundings, and a frown plays on her lips, which are slightly parted in thought. As she contemplates, her cell phone rings, drawing her attention just as the front door swings open, and David steps inside. Upon seeing him, she waves in acknowledgment and gestures to her phone, indicating that she is in the midst of a conversation. Understanding her silent communication, David approaches and hands her a steaming cup of coffee before proceeding to prepare his own cup in the compact kitchen of their cozy one-room flat. She ends the call and realizes that her phone screen displays four missed calls from Adrian, which makes her pause. David, observing the situation, looks up with a knowing expression, his thoughtful gaze wandering as she glances in another direction, her lips curling into a sad smile. 

David blinks and moves deliberately to a chair positioned beside her bed, meeting her gaze with a steady look. Elise swallows hard, feeling a mix of emotions, and momentarily lowers her eyes. When she looks up at him again, her smile becomes wistful, while David responds with a contented look of his own. Her eyes glimmer with unshed tears as she holds his gaze, and David's lips twitch into a crooked smile. Elise's smile slowly fades as she continues to stare into David's earnest eyes, maintaining the tender connection they share until both blink and David looks away. He juts out his jaw thoughtfully before locking eyes with her once more. 

In a different scene, Elise now sits quietly in a green room; meanwhile, in the studio, David shakes Jon Stewart's hand warmly and waves to the enthusiastic audience. At the same time, a man wearing a casual ball cap enters the green room, prompting Elise's shoulders to sag slightly as the man departs. She begins to gather her belongings. As the studio session concludes and David exits, the same man in the ball cap holds the door open for him, offering a nod. As David steps through the doorway, he is distracted by his phone, but upon lifting his gaze, he discovers himself unexpectedly in the cavernous Adjustment Bureau warehouse. 

He turns abruptly to the door he just passed through, only to find it locked. Puzzled, he tries another door without success and then attempts to lift a loading bay door, exerting effort to no avail. Now, David sits with his back leaning against a sturdy support beam, his mind racing as he stares into the distance, when suddenly, a figure materializes before him—the steely-eyed adjustment officer approaches purposefully. Rising to his feet, David fixes his stare on the officer and meets Thompson’s eyes, even as Thompson begins to pace away from him. Determined, David follows closely, observing Thompson as he halts, his thoughtful eyes blinking before shifting his gaze to another bay door, which starts to rise. Seizing the opportunity, David, with a determined look, hurries past Thompson toward the exit, while the adjustment officer blinks in disapproval.

Meanwhile, at Cedar Lake, a mesmerizing performance unfolds as dancers grace one section of a low, L-shaped stage with elegant twirls, while male dancers on the other section execute powerful leaps, dropping to their knees and spinning with precision. In the back of a taxi, David rides quietly, his eyes drifting to the window as the city's glimmering lights blur by. The taxi gradually slows in front of Cedar Lake, and David steps out, entering the vibrant dance studio and joining a cluster of patrons standing near a tiered stage section. Elise is seated serenely on the top platform, her feet resting on a bench below, and as she leans forward, a group of dancers gathering behind her lifts her gracefully into the air, creating a breathtaking tableau.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
As her eyes sweep across the familiar surroundings of the room, her gaze lingers on each detail, and a slight frown plays across her lips, which are parted slightly in thought. While she ponders over her musings, her cell phone interrupts the quiet with its insistent ringing, drawing her focus just as the front door swings open with a soft creak, allowing David to step inside with a purposeful stride. Catching sight of him, she raises a hand in acknowledgment, accompanied by a gentle wave, and gestures toward her phone, silently indicating that she is engaged in a conversation. Perceptive as always, David understands her non-verbal communication, approaching her with ease and offering her a steaming cup of coffee before turning his attention to the compact kitchen within the cozy confines of their one-room flat, where he proceeds to prepare his own cup. With the call ended, she glances at her phone screen, noticing with a sense of concern that there are four missed calls from Adrian, which causes her to pause and reflect. David, keenly observing the situation as it unfolds, looks up with a knowing expression, his thoughtful eyes wandering as she diverts her gaze, her lips curling into a smile tinged with sadness.

David blinks slowly, moving with deliberate intent to a chair positioned strategically beside her bed, where he meets her gaze with a steady, unwavering look. Elise swallows hard, feeling a swirling mix of emotions coursing through her, and momentarily lowers her eyes as though seeking solace. When she looks up at him once again, her smile transforms into one that is wistful, while David reciprocates with a look of contentment of his own. Her eyes shimmer with unshed tears as she holds his gaze tenderly, and David's lips twitch into a crooked smile of understanding. Elise’s smile gradually begins to fade, yet she continues to maintain the tender, silent connection they share through their gaze until both blink in unison, at which point David averts his eyes. He juts out his jaw thoughtfully before once more locking eyes with her in a moment of shared understanding.

In a scene that unfolds in a different setting, Elise now sits pensively in a green room, surrounded by the muted hum of the environment; meanwhile, in the vibrant studio, David engages warmly with Jon Stewart, shaking his hand firmly and waving to the enthusiastic, applauding audience. Simultaneously, a man wearing a casual ball cap enters the green room, prompting Elise's shoulders to sag ever so slightly as the man continues on his way out. Gathering her belongings with a sense of purpose, she prepares to leave. As the studio session wraps up and David makes his exit, the same man in the ball cap holds the door open for him, offering a nod of acknowledgment. David steps through the doorway, momentarily distracted by his phone, but upon raising his gaze, he finds himself unexpectedly within the expansive, cavernous space of the Adjustment Bureau warehouse.

He turns abruptly to the door through which he just entered, only to find it has become securely locked. Puzzled by this unexpected turn of events, he tries another door, meeting with similar frustration, and then attempts to lift a heavy loading bay door, exerting considerable effort but achieving no success. Now, seated with his back leaning against a sturdy support beam, his mind races as his eyes stare into the distance, when suddenly, a figure materializes before him—the steely-eyed adjustment officer approaching with purposeful intent. Rising to his feet in reaction, David fixes his determined stare on the officer, meeting Thompson’s gaze even as Thompson begins to pace away with measured steps. Driven by determination, David follows closely, watching as Thompson halts, his thoughtful eyes blinking before his gaze shifts to another bay door, which begins to rise with a smooth, mechanical motion. Seizing the opportunity with a determined look, David hurries past Thompson toward the exit, while the adjustment officer blinks in silent disapproval.

Meanwhile, at Cedar Lake, a mesmerizing performance unfolds as dancers grace one section of a low, L-shaped stage with elegant twirls and sweeping movements, while male dancers on the opposite section execute powerful leaps, dropping gracefully to their knees and spinning with precise elegance. Aboard a taxi, David rides quietly, his eyes naturally drifting to the window as the city's glittering lights blur into a kaleidoscope of colors. The taxi comes to a gradual halt in front of Cedar Lake, and David steps out with purpose, entering the vibrant dance studio and seamlessly joining a cluster of patrons gathered near a tiered section of the stage. Sitting serenely on the top platform, Elise rests her feet on a bench below, and as she leans forward gracefully, a group of dancers assembling behind her gently lifts her into the air, creating a breathtaking and awe-inspiring tableau.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: She briefly lets her eyes wander around the room, her lips slightly parted in contemplation, before frowning to herself. At that moment, her cell phone rings, and she swiftly answers it just as the front door opens, allowing David to enter. As David steps inside, she waves at him, simultaneously nodding towards her phone to indicate she is on a call. David acknowledges this by handing her a cup of coffee before proceeding to the small kitchen area within their one-room flat to make his own coffee. Once she finishes her call, she notices her phone screen displaying four missed calls from Adrian, which captures her attention. Meanwhile, David lifts his gaze knowingly, his eyes reflecting his thoughts, as she glances away for a moment before her lips curl into a sad smile. David blinks thoughtfully and moves to sit in a chair positioned beside her bed, looking at her intently as she meets his gaze. Overcome with emotion, Elise swallows hard and looks away momentarily. Gathering herself, she looks at him again, this time offering a wistful smile, which David acknowledges with a contented look. Her eyes well up with tears as their gazes lock, prompting David to return her gaze with a crooked smile. Yet, Elise's smile gradually fades as she looks deeper into David's earnest eyes, and they share a tender moment of connection before David blinks and diverts his gaze. He juts out his jaw in resolve, then locks eyes with her once more. Next, Elise finds herself seated in a vividly green room as, elsewhere in the studio, David exchanges a firm handshake with Jon Stewart and acknowledges the studio audience with a wave. In the interim, a man wearing a ball cap steps into the green room, causing Elise's shoulders to sag slightly as he exits. She calmly gathers her belongings, preparing to leave. Meanwhile, as David departs from the studio, the same man holds the door open for him. David walks through the doorway, busy typing a message on his phone, and upon lifting his gaze, finds himself unexpectedly inside the Adjustment Bureau warehouse. Quickly, he twists around to face the door he just passed through, only to discover it is locked, prompting him to try another door and then attempt to lift a stubborn loading bay door. His efforts proving futile, David eventually settles himself with his back against a sturdy support beam, staring off into the distance until a figure materializes before him—the unwavering gaze of a steely-eyed adjustment officer approaching with purpose. Rising to his feet, David locks eyes with the officer, Thompson, who turns and paces with measured strides as David trails behind, scrutinizing Thompson's movements. Thompson pauses, and his eyes flicker with thought as he shifts his gaze to a bay door that starts to ascend. With determination burning in his eyes, David seizes the opportunity and dashes past Thompson towards the opening exit, while the adjustment officer watches disapprovingly. Concurrently, at Cedar Lake, dancers perform with grace on a low, L-shaped stage—some twirl elegantly while male dancers leap energetically, drop to their knees, and spin with vigor. In the back of a cab, David observes the city's beautiful, glimmering lights passing by through his window. As the taxi decelerates in front of the Cedar Lake facility, David steps out and enters the dance studio, joining a crowd of patrons gathered near a tiered section of the stage. From her perch on the top platform, Elise watches, her feet resting casually on a bench beneath her. As she leans forward, the dancers congregated behind her lift her effortlessly into the air, continuing the performance.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Elise looks around, frowning slightly before answering her cell as David enters the one-room flat. She acknowledges him with a wave and a nod while he hands her a coffee and prepares his own. After hanging up, Elise notices missed calls from Adrian. David gives her a knowing look, prompting a sad smile from her, and he moves to sit by her bedside. As their eyes meet, Elise smiles wistfully, and they share tender glances, though her smile fades into a tearful gaze. Later, Elise waits in a green room while David appears on Jon Stewart's show. A man in a ball cap enters and exits the room, causing Elise to gather her things. As David leaves the studio, the man holds the door for him. While texting, David finds himself in the Adjustment Bureau warehouse, unsuccessfully trying doors until he sits against a support beam. Seeing a steely-eyed adjustment officer approach, David rises and follows Thompson, who signals a bay door to open. David seizes the opportunity to head for the exit as the officer disapproves. Meanwhile, at Cedar Lake, dancers perform on the L-shaped stage with graceful twirls and leaps. In a cab, David watches the city lights pass by, arriving at Cedar Lake where he joins other patrons near the stage. Elise, sitting above, is lifted into the air by dancers gathered behind her.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: She glances around the room, a modest space filled with the sounds of city life, and frowns to herself, her lips parted as if contemplating a response. She answers her cell as the front door opens, revealing David, who has just returned from his early morning walk through the bustling streets. She waves at David and nods at the phone; David, who learned to make excellent coffee during his summers in Italy, hands her a cup of the aromatic brew and then fixes his own coffee in the compact kitchen of the one-room flat they share downtown. She hangs up, noticing her phone shows four missed calls from Adrian, a close friend known for his impeccable timing, usually calling only when something truly important arises. David looks up knowingly, having seen the name flash on her screen often, his thoughtful gaze drifting as she glances aside and her lips spread into a sad smile. David blinks, understanding the weight of unspoken words, and moves to a chair at her bedside, as she meets his gaze. Swallowing hard, Elise averts her eyes, the heaviness of the moment sinking in. As she looks at him again, she smiles wistfully while David gives her a contented look, a silent promise of support. Her eyes glimmer with tears as she meets his gaze, and David crooks a smile, offering reassurance. Elise's smile fades as she stares into David's earnest eyes, and they gaze tenderly at each other before blinking and David looks away, his mind reflecting on their shared history. He juts out his jaw, a familiar gesture when he's deep in thought, then locks eyes with her. Now Elise sits in a green room, part of a television studio known for its vibrant interviews, as, in the adjacent studio, David shakes Jon Stewart's hand, a nod to his illustrious career as a humorous yet incisive commentator, and waves to the audience. Meanwhile, a guy in a ball cap, who often runs errands for the studio guests, enters the green room, Elise's shoulders sag as the man leaves, and she collects her belongings, preparing for the next step. Now as David leaves the studio, the man in the ball cap opens the door for him, a small courtesy in the world of showbiz. David texts as he walks through the doorway, and lifting his gaze from his phone, he finds himself in the Adjustment Bureau warehouse, a place known only to those who control destinies. He whips around to the closed door but finds it locked, tries another one, then attempts to lift a loading bay door, aware that escape is imminent. Now David sits with his back against a support beam, and as he stares off into the uncertain future, a figure appears—the steely-eyed adjustment officer approaches, representing the enigmatic force that guides events. Rising, David stares at him and looks Thompson in the eyes as Thompson paces away from him, embodying the relentless authority of fate itself. David follows, observing Thompson standing still, his thoughtful eyes blinking, shifting his gaze to a bay door which begins to rise, revealing a chance at freedom. With a determined look, David hurries past Thompson to the exit as the adjustment officer blinks his disapproving eyes, aware that not everyone defies their destiny. Meanwhile, at Cedar Lake, acclaimed for its contemporary ballet performances, dancers perform on one section of a low, L-shaped stage, twirling gracefully while male dancers leap across the other section, drop to their knees, and spin, displaying their athletic prowess. David rides in the back of a cab, his eyes shifting to his window as the city's glimmering lights glide past, a reminder of the life beyond the stage. The taxi slows in front of Cedar Lake, and now David enters the dance studio, joining a group of patrons standing near a tiered section of stage, anticipating the artistry about to unfold. Elise sits on the top platform, her feet resting on a bench below it; as she hunches forward, a group of dancers gathered behind her lifts her into the air, a breathtaking display of trust and synchronization.

David hands her a cup of coffee and then fixes his own coffee in the kitchen of the oneroom flat. She hangs up noticing her phone shows four missed calls from Adrian. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Meanwhile a guy in a ball cap enters the green room. Elise's shoulders sag as the man leaves and she collects her belongings. Now as David leaves the studio the man in the ball cap opens the door for him. David texts as he walks through the doorway and lifting his gaze from his phone. he finds himself in the Adjustment Bureau warehouse. He whips around to the closed door but finds it locked tries another one then attempts to lift a loading bay door. Now David sits with his back against a support beam and as he stares off a figure appears—the steelyeyed adjustment officer approaches. Rising. David stares at him and looks Thompson in the eyes as Thompson paces away from him. David follows observing Thompson standing still his thoughtful eyes blinking shifting his gaze to a bay door which begins to rise. With a determined look David hurries past Thompson to the exit as the adjustment officer blinks his disapproving eyes. Meanwhile at Cedar Lake dancers perform on one section of a low Lshaped stage twirling gracefully while male dancers leap across the other section drop to their knees and spin. David rides in the back of a cab his eyes shifting to his window as the city's glimmering lights glide past. The taxi slows in front of Cedar Lake and now David enters the dance studio joining a group of patrons standing near a tiered section of stage. Elise sits on the top platform her feet resting on a bench below it as she hunches forward a group of dancers gathered behind her lifts her into the air.

Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. Meanwhile a guy in a ball cap enters the green room. Elise's shoulders sag as the man leaves and she collects her belongings. Now as David leaves the studio the man in the ball cap opens the door for him. David texts as he walks through the doorway and lifting his gaze from his phone. he finds himself in the Adjustment Bureau warehouse. He whips around to the closed door but finds it locked tries another one then attempts to lift a loading bay door. Now David sits with his back against a support beam and as he stares off a figure appears—the steelyeyed adjustment officer approaches. Rising. David stares at him and looks Thompson in the eyes as Thompson paces away from him. David follows observing Thompson standing still his thoughtful eyes blinking shifting his gaze to a bay door which begins to rise. With a determined look David hurries past Thompson to the exit as the adjustment officer blinks his disapproving eyes. Meanwhile at Cedar Lake dancers perform on one section of a low Lshaped stage twirling gracefully while male dancers leap across the other section drop to their knees and spin. David rides in the back of a cab his eyes shifting to his window as the city's glimmering lights glide past. The taxi slows in front of Cedar Lake and now David enters the dance studio joining a group of patrons standing near a tiered section of stage. Elise sits on the top platform her feet resting on a bench below it as she hunches forward a group of dancers gathered behind her lifts her into the air.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: She glances around and frowns to herself her lips parted. She answers her cell as the front door opens and David enters. She waves at David and nods at the phone. David hands her a cup of coffee and then fixes his own coffee in the kitchen of the oneroom flat. She hangs up noticing her phone shows four missed calls from Adrian. David looks up knowingly his thoughtful gaze drifting as she glances aside and her lips spread into a sad smile. David blinks and moves to a chair at her bedside as she meets his gaze. Rising. David stares at him and looks Thompson in the eyes as Thompson paces away from him. David follows observing Thompson standing still his thoughtful eyes blinking shifting his gaze to a bay door which begins to rise. With a determined look David hurries past Thompson to the exit as the adjustment officer blinks his disapproving eyes. Meanwhile at Cedar Lake dancers perform on one section of a low Lshaped stage twirling gracefully while male dancers leap across the other section drop to their knees and spin. David rides in the back of a cab his eyes shifting to his window as the city's glimmering lights glide past. The taxi slows in front of Cedar Lake and now David enters the dance studio joining a group of patrons standing near a tiered section of stage. Elise sits on the top platform her feet resting on a bench below it as she hunches forward a group of dancers gathered behind her lifts her into the air.

test_cases.description: She glances around and frowns to herself her lips parted. She answers her cell as the front door opens and David enters. She waves at David and nods at the phone. David rides in the back of a cab his eyes shifting to his window as the city's glimmering lights glide past. The taxi slows in front of Cedar Lake and now David enters the dance studio joining a group of patrons standing near a tiered section of stage. Elise sits on the top platform her feet resting on a bench below it as she hunches forward a group of dancers gathered behind her lifts her into the air.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The giraffe peers curiously and sighs to itself, its ears twitching. The giraffe plays its guitar as the garage door swings open and Oliver skips inside. The giraffe salutes Oliver and hums to the instrument; Oliver delivers a bowl of soup and then prepares his own sandwich in the basement of the three-story villa. The giraffe strums, noticing its guitar indicates eight received messages from Marcus. Oliver gazes intently, his amused grin wandering as the giraffe peers upward and its ears perk into an amused grin. Oliver yawns and crawls to a sofa in front of it, as the giraffe meets his grin. Chuckling lightly, Jamie averts its hooves. As it eyes him again, it grins fondly while Oliver offers it a satisfied nod. Its ears twitch with laughter as it meets his grin and Oliver crooks a chuckle. Jamie's grin withers as it gawks into Oliver's honest grin, and they grin warmly at each other before yawning and Oliver glances aside. He puffs out his nostrils, then catches eyes with it. Now Jamie reclines in a blue tent as, in the arena, Oliver shakes Oprah's elbow and salutes to the spectators. Meanwhile, a cat in a cowboy hat skips into the blue tent, Jamie's hooves slump as the cat exits, and it gathers its trinkets. Now as Oliver exits the arena, the cat in the cowboy hat swings the gate for him. Oliver whistles as he saunters through the portal, and raising his grin from his guitar, he finds himself in the Transformation Chamber attic. He spins around to the sealed portal but finds it unlocked, tries another one, then attempts to pry a trapdoor ceiling. Now Oliver kneels with his shoulder against a metal column, and as he dreams off, a shadow emerges—the eagle-eyed transformation agent approaches. Standing, Oliver dreams at it and grins Jefferson in the ears as Jefferson strides away from him. Oliver chases, witnessing Jefferson sitting calmly, his forgetful ears yawning, wandering his grin to a trapdoor ceiling which begins to open. With a hopeful grin, Oliver races past Jefferson to the way out as the transformation agent yawns his approving grin. Meanwhile, at Pine Lake, skaters glide on one portion of an elevated, T-shaped platform, skating clumsily while female skaters stomp over the other portion, hop to their ankles, and tiptoe. Oliver glides in the front of a van, his grin wandering to his windshield as the village's flickering lanterns whisk past. The van speeds in front of Pine Lake, and now Oliver glides into the skating rink, joining a collection of visitors standing near a stacked portion of platform. Jamie reclines on the lower board, its hooves dangling over a table above it; as it squirms backward, a collection of skaters huddled before it bounces it into the sky.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Elise glances around as she answers her phone while David enters their one-room flat, handing her coffee. She notices missed calls from Adrian and shares a knowing, bittersweet look with David. Though tears fill her eyes, they exchange tender smiles. Later, David appears on Jon Stewart's show while Elise waits in the green room and eventually collects her things, looking dejected. As David exits the studio, he finds himself unexpectedly in the Adjustment Bureau warehouse, frantically searching for a way out. Confronted by officer Thompson, David remains determined and rushes past him when given the chance. Meanwhile, at Cedar Lake, dancers perform beautifully. David arrives by taxi, entering the dance studio where Elise is lifted into the air by fellow dancers.
